doc.field: Series XXIII: Pride and Progress / The Right Stuff
Series XXIII: Pride and Progress / The Right Stuff
[1]--Pride and Progress, Episode No. 29 [2]--The Right Stuff [Air Date: 7/15/1986]
[1]--Pride and Progress, Episode No. 29 [2]--The Right Stuff [Air Date: 7/15/1986]

Pride and ProgressNews-highlights:1. California, anti-gay Lyndon LaRouche is successful at getting an initiative on the ballot that would define AIDS as an infectious disease, allowing for quarantining, mandatory testing for suspected persons, and dismissal from public office2. Coverage of protests against the Georgia sodomy laws in New York City on July 4thCOMMERCIAL: Urban General Warehouse Sale3. Interview with Evan Wolfson from Lambda Legal Defense about Georgia sodomy laws and Bowers vs HardwickCOMMERCIAL: "First Hand" gay magazine4. Andy Humm on the July 4th demonstration against the sodomy laws and liberation5. July as "Make the President Aware Month"6. Los Angeles, Spanish-language AIDS hotline funded by the governmentCOMMERCIAL: "New York Native" with Quentin Crisp7. Sports Report8. Outreach: Conversations with GMHC: Interview with Bruce Patterson and Scott Jordan, discussing establishing a relationship in this anxious time and as a person with AIDS8. Closing credits
The Right Stuff:1. This Week in Gay History with Jeff BixbyCOMMERCIAL: "Manscape" magazine2. Coverage of the New York City Gay Pride Parade by GCN Cincinnati, with clipsCOMMERCIAL: Body Mate exercise equipment3. Small items and clips of new bathing suit styles for men, tape cuts off
[1]--Pride and Progress, Episode No. 29 [2]--The Right Stuff [Air Date: 7/15/1986]: July 1986
